title: Please figure out how this Checksum was derived
content:
I have hexadecimal data from first 5 blocks of T5557 125KHz RFID card. The 5th block appear to be some kind of checksum which I like to know how it is derived.
Below are 11 different samples of the data. Rows 1 to 5 in the tables represent block 1 to 5 of T5557 125 KHz RFID card.

Please note how changes in block 3 column 1 data  for samples 1,2,3 and 4,5 and 6,7 and 8,9 and 10,11 affect block 5 data.
Is anyone able to figure out how data in row 5 was derived?
Many thanks in advance.

comments.text: Have you read about how to reverse a CRC? E.g. hackaday.com/2019/06/27/â€¦
Please add more details as to what algorithms have you tried? Why do you think its a checksum? Any other correlation that you have done?

@sudhackar many thanks for your response. I have tried using CRC calculator at sunshine2k.de/coding/javascript/crc/crc_js.html. I think it is a checksum because of the way a single byte change in block 3 affects the data (block 5)
